body_html:
/usr/local/ is not in any default paths; that is precisely why homebrew chooses that directory to install packages to. Are you sure you have homebrew set up correctly? You may need to set some environment variables to have /usr/local recognized by your system.

I see that you are conda-build. The conda-build process is set up to use packages from an anaconda environment (also not on default system paths), and it's usually a bad idea to use some packages from conda and some packages from non-system brew locations.

The command you should be using is
./scripts/build_anaconda.sh --install-locally --skip-tests
If you are getting this failure when running the above command, please post the meta.yaml that's created by that script (ctrl-f "Finalized meta.yaml is") and the cmake output (ctrl-f "BUILD_ATEN" and use that whole section)
